docstr: `LOGICAL` â€” Convert to logical type ### Description Converts one kind of `LOGICAL` variable to another. ### Syntax `RESULT = LOGICAL(L [, KIND])` ### Arguments . | `KIND` | (Optional) An `INTEGER` initialization expression indicating the kind parameter of the result. ### Return value The return value is a `LOGICAL` value equal to `L`, with a kind corresponding to `KIND`, or of the default logical kind if `KIND` is not given. ### Standard Fortran 95 and later ### Class Elemental function ### See also INT, REAL, CMPLX
